name: giusto
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
exact: a written instruction used to tell a musician that they should perform at the exact tempo (= speed) that is shown: tempo giusto The third movement uses one of his trademark tempo indications, Tempo giusto. The duo plays six movements characterized by a stricter tempo giusto style. The composer's own interpretations are infinitely preferable to the inexpressive tempo giusto playing of so many modern pianists.
suitable: a written instruction used to tell a musician that they should perform at a suitable speed: The first movement leads into a fractured fugue, played allegro giusto. The initial larghetto progresses to an "allegro giusto" marking.
